remixlab.proscene
Interface MouseGrabbable

All Known Implementing Classes:
InteractiveAvatarFrame, InteractiveCameraFrame, InteractiveDrivableFrame, InteractiveFrame, MouseGrabber
public interface MouseGrabbable

Interface for objects that grab mouse focus in a Scene.

MouseGrabber are objects which react to the mouse cursor, usually when it hovers over them.

How does it work ?

All the created MouseGrabbers are grouped in a mouse grabber pool. The Scene parses this pool, calling all the MouseGrabbers' checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera) methods that setGrabsMouse(boolean) if desired (method calls should actually be performed on concrete class instances such as InteractiveFrame).

When a MouseGrabber grabsMouse(), it becomes the Scene.mouseGrabber(). All the mouse events are then transmitted to it instead of being normally processed. This continues while grabsMouse() (updated using checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera)) returns true.

If you want to (temporarily) disable a specific MouseGrabbers, you can remove it from this pool using Scene.removeFromMouseGrabberPool(MouseGrabbable).

Method Detail

checkIfGrabsMouse

void checkIfGrabsMouse(int x,
                       int y,
                       Camera camera)
Called by the Scene before it tests if the MouseGrabber grabsMouse(). Should setGrabsMouse(boolean) according to the mouse position.

This is the core method of the MouseGrabber. Its goal is to update the grabsMouse() flag according to the mouse and MouseGrabber current positions, using setGrabsMouse(boolean).

grabsMouse() is usually set to true when the mouse cursor is close enough to the MouseGrabber position. It should also be set to false when the mouse cursor leaves this region in order to release the mouse focus.

x and y are the mouse cursor coordinates ((0,0) corresponds to the upper left corner).

A typical implementation will look like:

// (posX,posY) is the position of the MouseGrabber on screen.
// Here, distance to mouse must be less than 10 pixels to activate the MouseGrabber.
setGrabsMouse( PApplet.sqrt((x-posX)*(x-posX) + (y-posY)*(y-posY)) < 10);

If the MouseGrabber position is defined in 3D, use the camera parameter, corresponding to the calling Scene Camera. Project on screen and then compare the projected coordinates:

PVector proj = new PVector (camera.projectedCoordinatesOf(myMouseGrabber.frame().position());
setGrabsMouse((PApplet.abs(x-proj.x) < 5) && (PApplet.(y-proj.y) < 2)); // Rectangular region

grabsMouse

boolean grabsMouse()
Should return true when the MouseGrabbable grabs the Scene mouse events.

setGrabsMouse

void setGrabsMouse(boolean grabs)
Should sets the grabsMouse() flag. Normally used by checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera).

Parameters:
grabs - flag

mouseClicked

void mouseClicked(Scene.Button button,
                  int numberOfClicks,
                  Camera camera)
Callback method called when the MouseGrabber grabsMouse() and a mouse button is clicked.

mousePressed

void mousePressed(Point eventPoint,
                  Camera camera)
Callback method called when the MouseGrabber grabsMouse() and a mouse button is pressed.

The MouseGrabber will typically start an action or change its state when a mouse button is pressed. mouseDragged(Point, Camera) (called at each mouse displacement) will then update the MouseGrabber accordingly and mouseReleased(Point, Camera) (called when the mouse button is released) will terminate this action.

mouseDragged

void mouseDragged(Point eventPoint,
                  Camera camera)
Callback method called when the MouseGrabber grabsMouse() and the mouse is moved while a button is pressed.

This method will typically update the state of the MouseGrabber from the mouse displacement. See the mousePressed(Point, Camera) documentation for details.

mouseReleased

void mouseReleased(Point eventPoint,
                   Camera camera)
Mouse release event callback method.

See Also:
mousePressed(Point, Camera)

mouseWheelMoved

void mouseWheelMoved(int rotation,
                     Camera camera)
Callback method called when the MouseGrabber grabsMouse() and the mouse wheel is used.
